page.title: 06Building as a Land Cover
page.content: There are large farm houses scattered around the area,with a number of small cottages which were originally tied cottages for the workers.The farms have numerous outbuildings such as barns,sheep shelters,pig_sties and hen houses.The village has an old market cross centre and the houses on the main street are built of stone,many have been renovated but kept their authentic frontage.As more people moved into the village,so the Local Authority built a small estate of post_war,semi_detached houses,behind the main street.Belford Hall is at present being renovated by English Heritage Trust and it is being made into 17 residential flats and houses. The people of Belford are proud of their gardens,which are beautifully kept.
